newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks seen falling further on fundamentals.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks seen falling further on fundamentals.

text.p: Thai stocks will fall again on Thursday as investors remain concerned about the country's fundamental economic conditions and worried about the possibility of rising U.S. interest rates, analysts said.
The SET Index finished 16.71 points lower on Wednesday at a new 5-1/2 year low of 626.57 in turnover worth 3.74 billion baht. The SET 50 lost 1.39 points to 45.96.

Lower economic growth prospects, focussed on the possibility of further budget cuts, a flat corporate earnings outlook, loan quality concerns and an overnight 140 point fall in New York will weigh negatively on sentiment, analysts said.

"I think the weakening bond market in the U.S. might rise fears that rates there could rise, that would make it more difficult for rates to come down again in Thailand," said a senior analyst at Thai Rung Reung.

Leading Thai commercial banks last week cut minimum lending rate by 25 basis points. Analysts said more cuts are required if the economy, already widely forecast to grow at a decade-low five percent this year, is to rebound.
Concerns surrounding lower growth have been heightened by the possibility of further budget cut to balance a potential fiscal deficit, analysts said.
